Statement (I) : The $$4 \mathrm{f}$$ and $$5 \mathrm{f}$$ - series of elements are placed separately in the Periodic table to preserve the principle of classification.

Statement (II) : S-block elements can be found in pure form in nature. 


In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :
questions.subject: Chemistry

options.A: Statement I is false but Statement II is true
options.B: Both Statement I and Statement II are true
options.C: Statement I is true but Statement II is false
options.D: Both Statement I and Statement II are false

$$
f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{cc}
\frac{\mathrm{a}\left(7 x-12-x^2\right)}{\mathrm{b}\left|x^2-7 x+12\right|} & , x3 \\\\
\mathrm{~b} & , x=3,
\end{array}\right.
$$

questions.question_text:
Consider the matrix $f(x)=\left[\begin{array}{ccc}\cos x & -\sin x & 0 \\ \sin x & \cos x & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 1\end{array}\right]$.


Given below are two statements :


Statement I : $ f(-x)$ is the inverse of the matrix $f(x)$.


Statement II : $f(x) f(y)=f(x+y)$.


In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below :
questions.subject: Mathematics

options.A: Statement I is false but Statement II is true
options.B: Both Statement I and Statement II are false
options.C: Both Statement I and Statement II are true
options.D: Statement I is true but Statement II is false

questions.question_text: Let $f(x)=x^3+x^2 f^{\prime}(1)+x f^{\prime \prime}(2)+f^{\prime \prime \prime}(3), x \in \mathbf{R}$. Then $f^{\prime}(10)$ is equal to ____________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: Let $f(x)=x^3+x^2 f^{\prime}(1)+x f^{\prime \prime}(2)+f^{\prime \prime \prime}(3), x \in \mathbf{R}$. Then $f^{\prime}(10)$ is equal to ____________.

questions.question_text: Let the set of all $a \in \mathbf{R}$ such that the equation $\cos 2 x+a \sin x=2 a-7$ has a solution be $[p, q]$ and $r=\tan 9^{\circ}-\tan 27^{\circ}-\frac{1}{\cot 63^{\circ}}+\tan 81^{\circ}$, then pqr is equal to ____________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: Let the set of all $a \in \mathbf{R}$ such that the equation $\cos 2 x+a \sin x=2 a-7$ has a solution be $[p, q]$ and $r=\tan 9^{\circ}-\tan 27^{\circ}-\frac{1}{\cot 63^{\circ}}+\tan 81^{\circ}$, then pqr is equal to ____________.

questions.question_text: Let for a differentiable function $f:(0, \infty) \rightarrow \mathbf{R}, f(x)-f(y) \geqslant \log _{\mathrm{e}}\left(\frac{x}{y}\right)+x-y, \forall x, y \in(0, \infty)$. Then $\sum\limits_{n=1}^{20} f^{\prime}\left(\frac{1}{n^2}\right)$ is equal to ____________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: Let for a differentiable function $f:(0, \infty) \rightarrow \mathbf{R}, f(x)-f(y) \geqslant \log _{\mathrm{e}}\left(\frac{x}{y}\right)+x-y, \forall x, y \in(0, \infty)$. Then $\sum\limits_{n=1}^{20} f^{\prime}\left(\frac{1}{n^2}\right)$ is equal to ____________.

questions.question_text: Let the area of the region $\left\{(x, y): x-2 y+4 \geqslant 0, x+2 y^2 \geqslant 0, x+4 y^2 \leq 8, y \geqslant 0\right\}$ be $\frac{\mathrm{m}}{\mathrm{n}}$, where $\mathrm{m}$ and $\mathrm{n}$ are coprime numbers. Then $\mathrm{m}+\mathrm{n}$ is equal to _____________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: Let the area of the region $\left\{(x, y): x-2 y+4 \geqslant 0, x+2 y^2 \geqslant 0, x+4 y^2 \leq 8, y \geqslant 0\right\}$ be $\frac{\mathrm{m}}{\mathrm{n}}$, where $\mathrm{m}$ and $\mathrm{n}$ are coprime numbers. Then $\mathrm{m}+\mathrm{n}$ is equal to _____________.

questions.question_text:
Let $A=\left[\begin{array}{lll}2 & 0 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 & 0 \\ 1 & 0 & 1\end{array}\right], B=\left[B_1, B_2, B_3\right]$, where $B_1, B_2, B_3$ are column matrics, and


$$
\mathrm{AB}_1=\left[\begin{array}{l}
1 \\
0 \\
0
\end{array}\right], \mathrm{AB}_2=\left[\begin{array}{l}
2 \\
3 \\
0
\end{array}\right], \quad \mathrm{AB}_3=\left[\begin{array}{l}
3 \\
2 \\
1
\end{array}\right]
$$



If $\alpha=|B|$ and $\beta$ is the sum of all the diagonal elements of $B$, then $\alpha^3+\beta^3$ is equal to ____________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question:
Let $A=\left[\begin{array}{lll}2 & 0 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 & 0 \\ 1 & 0 & 1\end{array}\right], B=\left[B_1, B_2, B_3\right]$, where $B_1, B_2, B_3$ are column matrics, and
$$
\mathrm{AB}_1=\left[\begin{array}{l}
1 \\
0 \\
0
\end{array}\right], \mathrm{AB}_2=\left[\begin{array}{l}
2 \\
3 \\
0
\end{array}\right], \quad \mathrm{AB}_3=\left[\begin{array}{l}
3 \\
2 \\
1
\end{array}\right]
$$

If $\alpha=|B|$ and $\beta$ is the sum of all the diagonal elements of $B$, then $\alpha^3+\beta^3$ is equal to ____________.

questions.question_text: The least positive integral value of $\alpha$, for which the angle between the vectors $\alpha \hat{i}-2 \hat{j}+2 \hat{k}$ and $\alpha \hat{i}+2 \alpha \hat{j}-2 \hat{k}$ is acute, is ___________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: The least positive integral value of $\alpha$, for which the angle between the vectors $\alpha \hat{i}-2 \hat{j}+2 \hat{k}$ and $\alpha \hat{i}+2 \alpha \hat{j}-2 \hat{k}$ is acute, is ___________.

questions.question_text: If $\alpha$ satisfies the equation $x^2+x+1=0$ and $(1+\alpha)^7=A+B \alpha+C \alpha^2, A, B, C \geqslant 0$, then $5(3 A-2 B-C)$ is equal to ____________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: If $\alpha$ satisfies the equation $x^2+x+1=0$ and $(1+\alpha)^7=A+B \alpha+C \alpha^2, A, B, C \geqslant 0$, then $5(3 A-2 B-C)$ is equal to ____________.

questions.question_text:
A fair die is tossed repeatedly until a six is obtained. Let $X$ denote the number of tosses required and let 

$a=P(X=3), b=P(X \geqslant 3)$ and $c=P(X \geqslant 6 \mid X>3)$. Then $\frac{b+c}{a}$ is equal to __________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: A fair die is tossed repeatedly until a six is obtained. Let $X$ denote the number of tosses required and let $a=P(X=3), b=P(X \geqslant 3)$ and $c=P(X \geqslant 6 \mid X>3)$. Then $\frac{b+c}{a}$ is equal to __________.

questions.question_text: Position of an ant ($$\mathrm{S}$$ in metres) moving in $$\mathrm{Y}$$-$$\mathrm{Z}$$ plane is given by $$S=2 t^2 \hat{j}+5 \hat{k}$$ (where $$t$$ is in second). The magnitude and direction of velocity of the ant at $$\mathrm{t}=1 \mathrm{~s}$$ will be :
questions.subject: Physics

questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements :

Statement (I) :Viscosity of gases is greater than that of liquids.

Statement (II) : Surface tension of a liquid decreases due to the presence of insoluble impurities.

In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :
questions.subject: Physics

options.A: Statement I is correct but statement II is incorrect
options.B: Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct
options.C: Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect
options.D: Both Statement I and Statement II are correct

questions.question_text:
A proton moving with a constant velocity passes through a region of space without any change in its velocity. If $$\overrightarrow{\mathrm{E}}$$ and $$\overrightarrow{\mathrm{B}}$$ represent the electric and magnetic fields respectively, then the region of space may have :

(A) $$\mathrm{E}=0, \mathrm{~B}=0$$
(B) $$\mathrm{E}=0, \mathrm{~B} \neq 0$$

(C) $$\mathrm{E} \neq 0, \mathrm{~B}=0$$

(D) $$\mathrm{E} \neq 0, \mathrm{~B} \neq 0$$

Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question:
A proton moving with a constant velocity passes through a region of space without any change in its velocity. If $$\overrightarrow{\mathrm{E}}$$ and $$\overrightarrow{\mathrm{B}}$$ represent the electric and magnetic fields respectively, then the region of space may have : 
(A) $$\mathrm{E}=0, \mathrm{~B}=0$$
(B) $$\mathrm{E}=0, \mathrm{~B} \neq 0$$ 
(C) $$\mathrm{E} \neq 0, \mathrm{~B}=0$$ 
(D) $$\mathrm{E} \neq 0, \mathrm{~B} \neq 0$$ 
Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :

Statement (I) : Planck's constant and angular momentum have same dimensions.

options.A: Statement I is true but Statement II is false

options.C: Both Statement I and Statement II are true
options.D: Statement I is false but Statement II is true

questions.question_text: A particle starts from origin at $$t=0$$ with a velocity $$5 \hat{i} \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}$$ and moves in $$x-y$$ plane under action of a force which produces a constant acceleration of $$(3 \hat{i}+2 \hat{j}) \mathrm{m} / \mathrm{s}^2$$. If the $$x$$-coordinate of the particle at that instant is $$84 \mathrm{~m}$$, then the speed of the particle at this time is $$\sqrt{\alpha} \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}$$. The value of $$\alpha$$ is _________.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A particle starts from origin at $$t=0$$ with a velocity $$5 \hat{i} \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}$$ and moves in $$x-y$$ plane under action of a force which produces a constant acceleration of $$(3 \hat{i}+2 \hat{j}) \mathrm{m} / \mathrm{s}^2$$. If the $$x$$-coordinate of the particle at that instant is $$84 \mathrm{~m}$$, then the speed of the particle at this time is $$\sqrt{\alpha} \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}$$. The value of $$\alpha$$ is _________.

questions.question_text: A thin metallic wire having cross sectional area of $$10^{-4} \mathrm{~m}^2$$ is used to make a ring of radius $$30 \mathrm{~cm}$$. A positive charge of $$2 \pi \mathrm{~C}$$ is uniformly distributed over the ring, while another positive charge of 30 $$\mathrm{pC}$$ is kept at the centre of the ring. The tension in the ring is ______ $$\mathrm{N}$$; provided that the ring does not get deformed (neglect the influence of gravity). (given, $$\frac{1}{4 \pi \epsilon_0}=9 \times 10^9$$ SI units)
questions.subject: Physics

questions.question_text: Two coils have mutual inductance $$0.002 \mathrm{~H}$$. The current changes in the first coil according to the relation $$\mathrm{i}=\mathrm{i}_0 \sin \omega \mathrm{t}$$, where $$\mathrm{i}_0=5 \mathrm{~A}$$ and $$\omega=50 \pi$$ rad/s. The maximum value of emf in the second coil is $$\frac{\pi}{\alpha} \mathrm{~V}$$. The value of $$\alpha$$ is _______.
questions.subject: Physics

The height of each column is $$6 \mathrm{~cm}$$. A coin is placed at the bottom of the beaker. For near normal vision, the apparent depth of the coin is $$\frac{\alpha}{4} \mathrm{~cm}$$. The value of $$\alpha$$ is _________.

The energy released in the process would be ______ $$\mathrm{MeV}$$.
